caption.p: Insertion and assembly of Î±-helical membrane proteins in membranes. (A and B) Membrane protein folding follows the two-stage model ( Popot and Engelman, 1990) involving synthesis and partitioning into the lipid bilayer, facilitated by insertases such as the translocon in cells (A), followed by the association of helices into the biological folded structure (B). Image of ribosome from Goodsell (2010), adapted from The Protein Data Bank. (C) Association of subunits or single helices provides a simplified model for studying the thermodynamics of membrane protein association in membranes.
